body_html: I am using CUDA (with cudNN) for both the runs. My guess is pytorch is slow because it is reading data from the hard drive, while keras is reading into the main memory first. But even then, will there be a 6x difference?
body_text: I am using CUDA (with cudNN) for both the runs. My guess is pytorch is slow because it is reading data from the hard drive, while keras is reading into the main memory first. But even then, will there be a 6x difference?
body: I am using CUDA (with cudNN) for both the runs. My guess is pytorch is slow because it is reading data from the hard drive, while keras is reading into the main memory first. But even then, will there be a 6x difference?
